definition: the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
(bird species of China) Indian cuckoo (Cuculus micropterus)

sentences.english: You know the four tones and the stuff. It really freaks me out.
sentences.chinese: 你知道四声那些东西，真够烦的。

sentences.english: Therefore, relevant historical literature recording his ignorance of four tones was unreliable.
sentences.chinese: 有关文献关于梁武帝不知四声的记载是不可靠的。

sentences.english: Four explosions shattered the stillness of the night air.
sentences.chinese: 四声爆炸声打破了夜晚的宁静。

sentences.english: I think this is an Indian Cuckoo.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这只是四声杜鹃。

definition: falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
level or even tone/first and second tones in modern Mandarin
falling and rising tone/third tone in modern Mandarin
first tone in Mandarin/high, level tone
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
evenly rising tone, the second tone of putonghua
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
